009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.HashSet;
015import java.util.Iterator;
016import java.util.LinkedList;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.mser.MserData;
021import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
022
023/**
024 * This class represents a tree of extremal image components.
025 * 
026 * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/11/19
029 */
030public abstract class ComponentTree<T> implements Iterable<Component<T>> {
031        
032        /**
033         * Enumeration specifying the method (algorithm) for building the component tree.
034         */
035        public enum Method {
036                /** Specifies the classic (global immersion) algorithm, see {@link ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion}. */
037                GlobalImmersion,
038                /** Specifies the linear-time algorithm, see {@link ComponentTreeLinearTime}. */
039                LinearTime;
040        }
041        
042        // --------------------------------------------------------------
043        
044        /** Constructor (non-public). */
045        ComponentTree() {}
046        
047        /**
048         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image using the default method
049         * ({@link Method#LinearTime}).
050         * 
051         * @param <T> the generic node type
052         * @param ip  the input image
053         * @return the component tree for the specified image
054         */
055        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip) {
056                return from(ip, Method.LinearTime);
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image.
061         * 
062         * @param <T>    the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
063         * @param ip     the input (gray-level) image
064         * @param method the method for building the component tree
065         * @return the component tree
066         */
067        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip, Method method) {
068                return from(new PixelMap(ip), method);
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Creates a new component tree for the specified {@link PixelMap}.
073         * 
074         * @param <T>    the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
075         * @param pm     a {@link PixelMap} instance
076         * @param method the method for building the component tree
077         * @return the component tree
078         */
079        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(PixelMap pm, Method method) {
080                switch (method) {
081                case LinearTime:  return new ComponentTreeLinearTime<>(pm);
082                case GlobalImmersion: return new ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion<>(pm);
083                }
084                return null;
085        }
086        
087        // --------------------------------------------------------------
088
089        /**
090         * Returns the root component of this component tree.
091         * To be implemented by concrete subclasses.
092         * @return the root component
093         */
094        public abstract Component<T> getRoot();
095
096        /**
097         * Returns an unordered collection of all tree components.
098         * To be implemented by concrete subclasses.
099         * @return all tree components
100         */
101        public abstract Collection<Component<T>> getComponents();
102        
103        @Override
104        public Iterator<Component<T>> iterator() {
105                return getComponents().iterator();
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * Finds and returns a collection of all leaf components of this tree. A leaf is
110         * a component which has no children.
111         * 
112         * @return all leaf components
113         */
114        public Collection<Component<T>> getLeaves() {
115                Collection<Component<T>> leaves = new LinkedList<>();
116                for (Component<T> c : getComponents()) {
117                        if (c.getChildren().isEmpty()) {
118                                leaves.add(c);
119                        }
120                }       
121                return leaves;
122        }
123        
124        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
125        
126        /**
127         * Performs integrity checks on this component tree.
128         * @return true iff all checks are passed
129         */
130        public boolean validate() {
131                if (!checkNodes()) {
132                        System.out.println("checkNodes failed");
133                        return false;
134                }
135                if (!checkParents()) {
136                        System.out.println("checkParents failed");
137                        return false;
138                }
139                if (!checkChildren()) {
140                        System.out.println("checkChildren failed");
141                        return false;
142                }
143                if (!checkRoot()) {
144                        System.out.println("checkRoot failed");
145                        return false;
146                }
147                if (!checkLevels()) {
148                        System.out.println("checkLevels failed");
149                        return false;
150                }
151                if (!checkSize()) {
152                        System.out.println("checkSize failed");
153                        return false;
154                }
155                return true;
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Checks if all tree nodes reachable through root are contained in components
160         * list and the tree has no duplicate nodes (and no cycles).
161         * 
162         * @return true iff OK
163         */
164        private boolean checkNodes() {
165                Set<Component<T>> componentSet = new HashSet<>(); // empty hash set
166                int duplicateID = traverse(getRoot(), componentSet);
167                if (duplicateID >= 0) {         // traverse() registers all visited components
168                        System.out.println("*** component tree has duplicate node: " + duplicateID);
169                        return false;
170                }
171                if (getComponents().size() != componentSet.size()) {
172                        System.out.println("*** some nodes in components list can not be reached!");
173                        return false;
174                }
175                return true;
176        }
177        
178        private int traverse(Component<T> c, Set<Component<T>> cS) {
179                if (cS.add(c)) {
180                        for (Component<T> cc : c.getChildren()) {
181                                int duplicateId = traverse(cc, cS);
182                                if (duplicateId >= 0) { // duplicate node
183                                        return duplicateId;
184                                };
185                        }
186                        return -1;      // everything OK, no duplicate node
187                }
188                else {  // c was already in set
189                        System.out.println("*** duplicate tree node: " + c.ID);
190                        return c.ID;
191                }
192        }
193
194        /**
195         * Checks if all parent relations are consistent.
196         * @return true iff OK
197         */
198        private boolean checkParents() {
199                Collection<Component<T>> comps = getComponents();
200                HashSet<Component<T>> compsH = new HashSet<>(comps); // to improve lookup speed
201                
202                for (Component<?> c : comps) {
203                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
204                        if (p == null) {
205                                continue;
206                        }
207                        
208                        // check if parent is listed in 'components' (use HashSet for speed)
209                        if (!compsH.contains(p)) {
210                                System.out.println("*** component not contained in components list: " + c.ID);
211                                return false;
212                        }
213                                                
214                        // check if parent is not c itself
215                        if (p == c) {
216                                System.out.println("*** self-referring parent link in component " + c.ID);
217                                return false;
218                        }                               
219                }
220                return true;
221        }
222        
223        /**
224         * Checks if all child relations are consistent.
225         * 
226         * @return true iff OK
227         */
228        private boolean checkChildren() {
229                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
230                        // check if children is a list (not null)
231                        if (c.getChildren() == null) {
232                                System.out.println("*** children is null (not an empty list) in component " + c.ID);
233                                return false;
234                        }
235                        
236                        // check if all children of c have c as parent
237                        for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
238                                // check if c is parent of its child:
239                                if (child.getParent() != c) {
240                                        System.out.println("*** incorrect parent link in component " + child.ID);
241                                        return false;
242                                }
243                        }       
244                }
245                return true;
246        }
247        
248        /**
249         * Checks if the tree has a unique root.
250         * 
251         * @return true iff OK
252         */
253        private boolean checkRoot() {
254                // check if a single root exists and is properly marked (with null parent)
255                int rootcnt = 0;
256                Component<T> root = getRoot();
257                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
258                        if (c.getParent() == null) {
259                                rootcnt++;
260                                if (c != root) {
261                                        System.out.println("*** found non-root node without parent: " + c.ID);
262                                        return false;
263                                }
264                        }
265                }
266                if (rootcnt > 1) {
267                        System.out.println("*** found multiple roots: " + rootcnt);
268                        return false;
269                }
270                return true;
271        }
272        
273        /**
274         * Checks if all local pixels of have the same value as {@link #level}.
275         * 
276         * @return true iff OK
277         */
278        private boolean checkLevels() {
279                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
280                        int lc = c.getLevel();
281                        
282                        // check if parent's level is greater than this component's level:
283                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
284                        if (p != null) {
285                                int lp = p.getLevel();
286                                if (lc >= lp) { // must be lc < lp
287                                        System.out.println("*** value lc >= lp for component " + c.ID);
288                                }
289                        }
290                        
291                        // check if all local points have the same level as this component's level:
292                        for (Pixel x : c.getLocalPixels()) {
293                                if (x.val != lc) {
294                                        System.out.println("*** local pixel with wrong value in component " + c.ID);
295                                        return false;
296                                }
297                        }
298                }
299                return true;
300        }
301        
302        /**
303         * Checks if the size of each component is the same as the number of local
304         * pixels plus the combined size of all children.
305         * 
306         * @return true iff OK
307         */
308        private boolean checkSize() {
309                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
310                        int csize = c.getLocalPixels().size();
311                        for (Component<?> cc : c.getChildren()) {
312                                csize = csize + cc.getSize();
313                        }
314                        if (csize != c.getSize()) {
315                                System.out.println("*** wrong size in component " + c.ID);
316                                return false;
317                        }
318                }
319                return true;
320        }
321        
322        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
323        
324        @Override
325        public String toString() { 
326                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
327                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
328                this.printToStream(ps);
329                return os.toString();
330        }
331        
332        private void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
333                strm.print(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": ");
334                strm.format("   number of components: %d\n", getComponents().size());
335                for (Component<?> r : getComponents()) {
336                        r.printToStream(strm);
337                        strm.println();
338                }
339                strm.println("root = " + getRoot());
340        }
341        
342        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
343        
344        private static int INDENT = 4;
345        
346        // print a forest with multiple roots
347        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
348        private static String toStringRecursive(ComponentTree<?> rt) { 
349                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
350                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
351                
352                for (Component<?> c : rt) {
353                        if (c.getParent() == null || c.getParent() == c) {      // start at any root
354                                printToStreamRecursive(c, ps, 0);
355                        }       
356                }       
357                return os.toString();
358        }
359        
360        // print tree with a single root
361        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
362        private static String toStringRecursive(Component<?> rt) { 
363                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
364                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
365                printToStreamRecursive(rt, ps, 0);      
366                return os.toString();
367        }
368        
369        
370        private static void printToStreamRecursive(Component<?> c, PrintStream ps, int indent) {
371                for (int i=0; i < indent; i++) {
372                        ps.append('|');
373                        for (int j = 0; j < INDENT; j++) {
374                                ps.append(' ');
375                        }
376                }
377                c.printToStream(ps);
378                ps.println();
379                for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
380                        printToStreamRecursive(child, ps, indent + 1);
381                }
382        }
383
384}
